root_causes: Two SELECT IF statements are used sequentially which will cause the second SELECT IF (hard-screen) to overwrite the first selection (validation), so you will not get both validation and hard-screen listings.

The branch that handles MISSING(qCountry) only checks NOT MISSING(FR2) and does not explicitly include an invalid-value check for FR2 (e.g. FR2<1 OR FR2>2). While NOT MISSING will catch non-system-missing special codes, the intent in the expected logic to flag both presence and invalid values when qCountry is system-missing is not expressed explicitly.
instructions: Do not use two SELECT IF statements back-to-back. Use TEMPORARY plus a separate SELECT IF (or a separate reporting block) for each listing so the validation listing and the HARD-SCREEN listing are produced independently. Example: TEMPORARY. SELECT IF ((MISSING(qCountry) AND (NOT MISSING(FR2) OR FR2<1 OR FR2>2)) OR (qCountry = 12 AND (MISSING(FR2) OR FR2 < 1 OR FR2 > 2)) OR (qCountry <> 12 AND NOT MISSING(FR2))). LIST respid FR2.

For the hard-screen listing, use a separate temporary selection: TEMPORARY. SELECT IF (qCountry = 12 AND FR2 = 2). LIST respid FR2. This preserves the validation selection and produces the separate disqualification listing required.

Make the MISSING(qCountry) branch explicit about invalid FR2 values by changing (MISSING(qCountry) AND NOT MISSING(FR2)) to (MISSING(qCountry) AND (NOT MISSING(FR2) OR FR2 < 1 OR FR2 > 2)) so records with invalid FR2 codes are clearly flagged when qCountry is system-missing.

root_causes: Script treats special codes 97, 98, 99 as acceptable responses for FR2 (both for eligible and ineligible respondents) even though the expected valid answers are only 1 or 2.

For respondents with qCountry != 12 the script does not flag cases where FR2 equals 97/98/99 (it only flags non-missing values that are not 97/98/99) â€” expected logic requires FR2 to be missing for ineligible respondents.
instructions: Change the validation so only answers 1 or 2 are treated as valid for respondents with qCountry = 12. Example: for qCountry=12, flag respondents where MISSING(FR2) OR FR2 < 1 OR FR2 > 2 (do not exempt 97/98/99).

For respondents with qCountry != 12, flag any non-missing FR2 value (including 97/98/99). Example replacement SELECT IF clause: TEMPORARY. SELECT IF ((qCountry = 12 AND (MISSING(FR2) OR FR2 < 1 OR FR2 > 2)) OR (qCountry NE 12 AND NOT MISSING(FR2))). LIST respid qCountry FR2.

If special codes 97/98/99 are in fact intended to be valid for this question, explicitly document that in the expected logic. Otherwise remove the (FR2 NE 97 AND FR2 NE 98 AND FR2 NE 99) exceptions from both parts of the condition so those codes are treated as invalid/missing according to the expected logic.

root_causes: Hard-screen condition (UK1 = 3) is not being flagged; the script only checks for missing or out-of-range answers but does not treat UK1=3 as a failure as required by the hard-screen.
The SELECT IF logic for eligible respondents (flt = 1) does not include an explicit check for UK1 = 3 even though the expected logic requires hard-screening when UK1 equals 3.
instructions: Modify the SELECT IF clause for flt = 1 to explicitly flag UK1 = 3. Replace the existing flt = 1 condition: (flt = 1 AND (MISSING(UK1) OR ( (UK1 < 1 OR UK1 > 3) AND (UK1 NE 97 AND UK1 NE 98 AND UK1 NE 99) )))
With this updated condition that includes the hard-screen: (flt = 1 AND (MISSING(UK1) OR UK1 = 3 OR ((UK1 < 1 OR UK1 > 3) AND (UK1 NE 97 AND UK1 NE 98 AND UK1 NE 99))))
Keep the flt = 0 branch (flagging unexpected answers when the question should be skipped) as-is, since it correctly flags UK1 present for ineligible countries.

root_causes: The SELECT IF expression is missing a logical operator between the two main parenthesized conditions (the flt=1 branch and the flt=0 branch), causing the intended OR logic to be absent and making the statement invalid.
Because of the missing operator the code will not implement the intended two-branch logic (US vs non-US) correctly.
instructions: Insert an OR between the two parenthesized condition groups in the SELECT IF so both branches are combined. For example: SELECT IF ((flt = 1 AND (MISSING(US1) OR ((US1 < 1 OR US1 > 3) AND (US1 NE 97 AND US1 NE 98 AND US1 NE 99)))) OR (flt = 0 AND (NOT MISSING(US1) AND (US1 NE 97 AND US1 NE 98 AND US1 NE 99)))).

Verify parentheses are balanced after adding the OR and that the logic matches: - If qCountry=1033 (flt=1): flag when US1 is missing OR US1 is outside 1..3 and not 97/98/99. - If qCountry<>1033 (flt=0): flag when US1 is non-missing and not one of 97/98/99.

root_causes: Entry condition f('qCountry').any('12') from the expected logic is not applied in either the missing/invalid-code check or the hard-screen (terminate) check.
instructions: Apply the country entry condition to all checks. For example, restrict the validation listing to respondents in country code 12: temporary. sel if qCountry=12 and (miss(FR2) or ~any(FR2,1,2)). list respid, FR2. del temp.
Also restrict the hard-screen listing to respondents in country code 12: temporary. sel if qCountry=12 and FR2=2. list respid, FR2. del temp.

root_causes: Entry condition f('qCountry').any('16') from the expected logic is not applied in either the missing/invalid-code check or the hard-screen (terminate) check.
instructions: Apply the country entry condition to the validation step: temporary. sel if qCountry=16 and (miss(IT1) or ~any(IT1,1,2,3)). list respid, IT1. del temp.
Apply the country entry condition to the hard-screen step: temporary. sel if qCountry=16 and IT1=3. list respid, IT1. del temp.

root_causes: Entry condition f('qCountry').any('10') from the expected logic is not applied in either the missing/invalid-code check or the hard-screen (terminate) check.
instructions: Apply the country entry condition to the validation step: temporary. sel if qCountry=10 and (miss(ES1) or ~any(ES1,1,2,3)). list respid, ES1. del temp.
Apply the country entry condition to the hard-screen step: temporary. sel if qCountry=10 and ES1=3. list respid, ES1. del temp.

root_causes: Entry condition (f('qCountry').any('2057') || f('qCountry').any('3081')) from the expected logic is not applied in either the missing/invalid-code check or the hard-screen (terminate) check.
instructions: Apply the country entry condition to the validation step: temporary. sel if any(qCountry,2057,3081) and (miss(UK1) or ~any(UK1,1,2,3)). list respid, UK1. del temp.
Apply the country entry condition to the hard-screen step: temporary. sel if any(qCountry,2057,3081) and UK1=3. list respid, UK1. del temp.

root_causes: Entry condition f('qCountry').any('1033') from the expected logic is not applied in either the missing/invalid-code check or the hard-screen (terminate) check.
instructions: Apply the country entry condition to the validation step: temporary. sel if qCountry=1033 and (miss(US1) or ~any(US1,1,2,3)). list respid, US1. del temp.
Apply the country entry condition to the hard-screen step: temporary. sel if qCountry=1033 and US1=3. list respid, US1. del temp.

root_causes: Entry condition f('qCountry').any('1033') from the expected logic is not applied in the missing/invalid-code check.
instructions: Apply the country entry condition to the validation step: temporary. sel if qCountry=1033 and (miss(US2) or ~any(US2,1,2)). list respid, US2. del temp.
